alert.note: Alert for Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 9:24PM EST until January 12 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... North Branch Rancocas Creek At Pemberton affecting Burlington County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...North Branch Rancocas Creek at Pemberton. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 2.5 feet, Some minor flooding begins in Eastampton along Rustic, Peninsula, and Paducah Roads. Lee Street, Joe Road, and Jill Court in Southampton also begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 2.52 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM EST Thursday was 2.6 feet. - Forecast...The river level will continue to slowly fall overnight and Friday. More rains are forecast for Friday night. Levels may rise again this weekend. - Flood stage is 2.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 2.5 feet on 08/24/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date North Branch Ran Pemberton 2.5 2.52 Thu 9 pm 2.4 2.4 Crested and falling &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM EST.
